Posts.Content: Apr 30, 2009 10:07PM teri50 wrote: Everyminute. I love your hair.  I'm 6 months out from chemo and my hair is probably an inch long and curly most days.   Have had one trim to get it evened up. My hairstylist said it helps hair growth when you get  your blood moving.  So another good reason to exercise.  Also giving your head a good massage everyday will help.   Both are easy enough to do.  I'm also using Nioxin.  She said she'd hear that is a good product.  I love having some hair again.  lol. Teri

Posts.Title: Cording after surgery teri50 FACECRAFTER

Posts.Content: teri50 wrote: I had bilater mast last December.  My left side had 26 axillary nodes taken, while I just had the sentinal nodes taken from the right side. I then had radiation this past Spring on the left side.  The side that was radiated has developed, what I think, is cording.  The muscles are also much tighter than the other side that only had the sentinal nodes taken.   Has anyone had experience with cording?  What did you do for it?  Just stretching exercises or also physical therapy? Thanks for your help.   Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Cording after surgery teri50 FACECRAFTER

Posts.Content: Oct 13, 2009 02:27PM teri50 wrote: In the Fall of 07 I had a section of dimpling on my left breast.  That breast was also denser than my right one.  That Fall I had a regular mammo which didn't show anything.  By the next Spring I went to my doctor and she sent me to get an ultrasound which did show a mass.  They did a biopsy and I had ILC.  Please be sure and get your's checked out with an ultrasound or mri.
